question.questionText: Ron covered his notebook with waxed paper. Then he placed a small drop of water in the middle of the notebook as shown in the picture. Even though the drop was on a slope, the drop stayed where he placed it. Describe 2 ways Ron can make the water move down the notebook without pushing the drop or blowing on it.

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: Ron could make the drop bigger. Ron could make the slope steeper.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: Putting more water in the drop.
Slant it a little more because if it is not slanted enough it will not move down.
Ron put 2 dictionaries under your book.
He can tilt it more.
He can put another drop of water on top of the other one.
You put a fat book on a the bottom of a it to make it go down.
Ron could take out about 2 or 3 papers to make the slope steeper.
Ron could add more water to the notebook because a small drop, like Ron has does not flow down a slope that fast, a bigger drop goes faster.
He could take all the paper out. Because than the slant would push the water down.
One way he can do it is making the notebook steeper.
Ron could of put one or 2 books under his notebook and make it steeper the water would go down.
Ron can add more and more drops on the little bead more.
Ron could make the slope steeper.
Ron can put something under his book like so it is hi to low.
Ron can grab the book and make it more of a slope.
Lifting up the notebook so it will be steeper slope.
He can simply lift the notebook to a sharp angle.
Tilting it so it can move.
He could make the drop bigger by adding more water.
Ron can make the slope higher to make the drop go at a faster flow.
Make the notebook.

First thing you can do is tip the binder down and the drop will follow.
Ron can put another book under the notebook and it will go higher which will make it go down.
You could add more water to the drop.
Ron can put soapy water on the drop and break the surface tension.
You can drop like 4 drops on the water so it can go fast.
He can light drop it was fast.

Put books under notebook to make a steeper slope.
Ron can increase the drop by adding more water and it will flow.

He could make the slope steeper.

Make it big.

Well if I cannot push it then I probably want to take the end of the binder and lift it all the way up.

Make the slope steeper.
You can make the drop bigger.
He can make the drop bigger so it will go faster down it.
He can make the slope more steep.

The first way he can make it go down the slope is to make the drop bigger.
